title: Graphs
concept: This level focuses on graph representations and algorithms — adjacency list, BFS, DFS, connected components, cycle detection, bipartite check, topological sort, shortest path in unweighted graph, and MST (Kruskal with DSU logic simplified).

challenges.title: Build Graph & Print Adjacency List
challenges.description: Given N nodes and M edges (undirected), build adjacency list and print neighbors of each node in sorted order.

challenges.title: BFS Traversal
challenges.description: Given graph and starting node S, perform BFS and print order of visits.

challenges.title: DFS Traversal
challenges.description: Given graph and starting node S, perform DFS and print order of visits.

challenges.title: Connected Components

challenges.title: Cycle Detection in Undirected Graph
challenges.description: Given undirected graph, detect if it contains a cycle. Print Yes / No.

challenges.title: Check Bipartite (Graph Coloring)
challenges.description: Color graph using 2 colors (0/1). If conflict occurs print No else Yes.

challenges.title: Topological Sort (DAG only)
challenges.description: Given directed graph perform topological ordering using Kahn’s BFS (indegree method).

challenges.title: Shortest Path in Unweighted Graph
challenges.description: Find shortest distance from S to all nodes using BFS. Print distances (-1 if unreachable).
